sentences.en: A photograph of the Pingnan Cloister Garden.
sentences.cn: 这三张图是平南天主教的修道院的花园.

sentences.en: He coiled around the moist cloister pillars.
sentences.cn: 他环抱着回廊那潮湿的柱子.

sentences.en: It’s probably dangerous to enter exclusively into this realm and risk being caught in a cloister, removed from the market and its accountability.
sentences.cn: 如果专门只进入这个领域并且冒着陷于修道院、远离尘世及其责任的风险很可能是危险的。

sentences.en: Some people go to a cloister in order to avoid problems of everyday life, and Yuri came to a circus.
sentences.cn: 为了逃避生活中的烦恼，有的人会选择去修道院。 但是尤里选择了去马戏团。

sentences.en: The ancient cloister was a structure of red brick picked out with white stone.
sentences.cn: 古老的修道院是一座白石衬托着的红砖建筑物.

sentences.en: The cloister linked the most important elements of an abbey together.
sentences.cn: 大修道院以回廊把最主要的建筑连接在一起.

sentences.en: They went out into the still, shadowy cloister garden.
sentences.cn: 他们出了房间,走到那个寂静 、 阴沉的修道院的园子里去.

sentences.en: To furnish ( a building ) with a cloister.
sentences.cn: 设回廊于用回廊装饰 ( 一幢建筑 )

sentences.en: To shut away from the world in or as if in a cloister; seclude .
sentences.cn: 与 尘世 隔离好像在修道院里一样.

sentences.en: What you beheld was the interior of a cloister.
sentences.cn: 你所看见的是一个修道院的内部。

sentences.en: When I stepped out of the cloister I had no idea where my path would lead.
sentences.cn: 当我跨出修道院,我不知人生将走向何处.

sentences.en: You may still long for cloister, but learn this lesson first.
sentences.cn: 纵然盼望回到过去, 可是要首先学会生.

words.tran_cn: 修道院的；遁世的；孤独的
使与尘世隔绝；在…设回廊（cloister的过去分词）
回廊；修道院；修道院生活；隐居地

trans.tran_cn: （学院、修道院、教堂等建筑的）走廊，回廊，修道院的生活，隐居
trans.tran_en: a covered passage that surrounds one side of a square garden in a church,  monastery  etc
